flawed_nl_solution:
The truck driver drives for 10 hours at 30 miles per hour, so she drives 10*30=<<10*30=300>>300 miles.
Therefore, she needs 300/10=<<300/10=30.0>>30.0 gallons of gas.
This will cost her 30.0*$2=$<<30.0*2=60.0>>60.0.
She will make 300*$0.5= $<<300*0.5=150.0>>150.0.
Thus, after paying for gas, she will make $150.0-$60.0=$<<150.0-60.0=91.0>>91.0.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 90.0, not 91.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
